Scratchpad

The scratchpad feature has been added mostly to deal with the Android marshalling limitations and lack of the ability to track the content URI reference count.

Selected terminal buffer content can be copied to the scratchpad by tapping the 💾 button.

If the size of content to be copied/shared exceeds the limitation specified in the Settings menu or its marshalling fails, it is also copied to the scratchpad and its content URI is used.

If an entry is deleted after copying or sharing it, the clipboard content becomes obsolete or the recipient application could fail to use it if its content URI is still not opened (very unlikely in the real world) respectively.

Note: Applications could treat contents copied by value and by URI differently; for example: browsers usually ignore anything pasted into their search field if it is represented by the content URI only.
